Dear Tia M. Cobb:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at 517-243-9743.
Sincerely,

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Program Statement
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents’ needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 11/01/24, Youth A and Youth B broke into the control room at
the facility. Staff attempted to get the youth out, but Youth B
refused and began physically fighting with staff. Youth attempted
to stab staff with a pen.
Investigation Complainant was interviewed via telephone on 11/04/2024.
Complainant reported Staff 1 was in the control room, then walked
out of the control room, but did not secure the control room door,
and that’s how Youth A and Youth B got into the control room.
Youth A was interviewed at the agency on 11/07/2024, in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Youth A has been at the
agency for one month. He is currently placed on Pod F but was
previously on pod G. Youth A reported on 11/01/2024, while staff
were getting them ready to step down for the night, Staff 1 was
outside the control room, so he and Youth B wrapped their shirts
around their faces and ran into the control room. Staff 1 followed
them and tried to get them to leave the control room. Youth A
admitted he pushed Staff 1 and ran towards the back of the
control room. He said Supervisor 1 came and was trying to get
him to go back to the pod, so he grabbed a pen and tried to stab
Supervisor 1. He said he blacked out and cannot recall what
happened but thinks that Supervisor 1 and Staff 1 grabbed his
arms and escorted him out of the control room. Once he was back
on the pod, he recalls he was fighting with staff and trying to stab
them with a pen. He did stab Staff 1 with the pen. Youth A
reported the control room is always locked and knows youths are
not allowed to go into the control room.
Youth B was interviewed at the agency on 11/07/2024, in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Youth B reported it was
Youth A’s idea to go into the control room. He and Youth A
wrapped their shirts around their face and when Staff 1 came out
2

of the control room they ran into the control room. He said Staff 1
followed them and had tried to get him and Youth A to go back to
the pod. He went back to the pod, but Youth A started to fight with
Staff 1 and ran to the back of the control room. He denied
witnessing staff hit or hurt Youth A.
Staff 1 was interviewed at the agency on 11/07/2024, in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Staff 1 reported he and Staff
2 were working on the day of the incident. He was in the control
room getting ready for the youths to step down for the night. He
saw Youth A and Youth B had wrapped their shirts around their
faces like ski masks. He left the control room and did not secure
the door to close and was talking to the two youths and that’s
when they got up and ran into the control room. Staff 1 followed
the two youths and attempted to verbally de-escalate them and
get them out of the control room. He said Youth B was more
cooperative, but Youth A became more escalated, was pressing
buttons, grabbing things, broke the walkie talkie, and ran to the
back of the control room. Supervisor 1 arrived on the scene and
assisted Staff 1 in escorting Youth A out of the control room. Staff
1 said Youth A took a pen from the control room and stabbed his
hand with the pen. Staff 1 denied hitting or hurting Youth A while
in the control room. Staff 1 said he has a good rapport with Youth
A and can usually talk him down when escalated.
Administrator was interviewed at the agency on 11/07/2024, in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Administrator reported she
reviewed the video footage of the incident on 11/01/2024. She
said Staff 1 walked out of the control room and left the door open.
Youth A and Youth B ran inside the control room. She said staff
know that the control room door should never be left opened.
There are no cameras in the control rooms. She said Youth A and
Youth B had been at a previous placement together and it
appears that they had been planning on getting into the control
room. Administrator said the agency is looking at permanently
closing the control room doors from inside the pods to prevent any
youths from getting into the control room. Staff would only be able
to access the control room from the outside of the pod.
JJ Worker was interviewed via telephone on 11/12/2024. JJ
Worker reported she was notified of the incident and does not
have concerns regarding the way staff handled the situation. JJ
worker expressed concerns regarding the way staff talk to the
youths. She has overheard staff while on the phone with Youth A
cuss back at Youth A when Youth A cusses at staff. She said
3

they spoke unprofessional, but specific examples weren’t
provided.
Staff 2 was interviewed at the agency on 11/14/2024, in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Staff 2 recalled working on
11/01/2024 with Staff 1 on Pod G. Staff 2 reported Staff 1 was in
the control room and walked out to talk to Youth A and Youth B,
because they had wrapped their shirts around their faces. Youth A
and Youth B ran into the control room, Staff 1 followed them, and
she called for assistance. Supervisor 1 and Supervisor 2 arrived to
assist. She said Youth A was throwing things, hitting Staff 1, and
flipped the table in the control room. Supervisor 1 and Staff 1
escorted Youth A out of the control room. She said it took several
minutes to get Youth A to calm down. Youth A had a pen and did
try stabbing the staff once he was back on the pod. She said
Youth B complied with staff and walked out of the control room
without incident. Youth A was escalated and aggressive with staff,
but at no point did staff hit or hurt Youth A.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed at the agency on 11/14/2024, in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Supervisor 1 reported on
11/01/2024 he and Supervisor 2 responded to call for assistance
due to Youth A and Youth B getting into the control room.
Supervisor arrived on the pod and observed Youth A and Youth B
in the control room. Youth A was running around, throwing things,
and swinging at Staff 1. Youth B cooperated and walked out of the
control room without incident. Youth A refused to cooperate, and
he and Staff 1 had to use a two-person standing hold and escort
Youth A out of the control room. Once Youth A was back on the
pod, they released the hold. Youth A continued to be escalated
and attempted to stab staff with a pen. He and Staff 1 continued to
verbally de-escalate Youth A to get him to give them the pen. After
several minutes he retrieved the pen from Youth A. Supervisor 1
denied Youth A was hurt or injured during the incident. Supervisor
1 reported youths are not allowed in the control room and staff
know that they should always secure the control room door.
Supervisor 2 was interviewed at the agency on 11/14/2024, in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Supervisor 2 reported he
and Supervisor 1 responded to a call due to Youth A and Youth B
getting into the control room. Supervisor 1 assisted Staff 1 with
escorting Youth A out of the control room. He denied witnessing
Staff 1 hit or hurt Youth A while escorting him out of the control
room. Supervisor 2 reported Youth A was aggressive, running
around punching and hit his head against the wall on the pod.
4

Youth A was interviewed at the agency on 01/10/2025. Youth A
denied any incidents involving staff cussing or using inappropriate
language. Youth A reported he has been attending school and
participating in individual and group therapy.
Youth B and Youth C were interviewed at the agency on
01/10/2025. Youth B and Youth C denied any staff cussing at
them or witnessing a staff member speak inappropriately with
Youth A. Youth B and Youth C reported all their needs are being
met and did not express any concerns regarding staff or the
facility.
Video Footage Reviewed:
Video footage dated 11/01/2024 of Pod G reviewed on
11/07/2024. Staff 1 was in the control room, Staff 2 was sitting at a
table outside of the control room, Staff 1 walked out of the control
room, leaving the control room door open, walked towards Youth
A and Youth B, Staff 1 spoke to the two Youths. Youth A and
Youth B had their sweaters wrapped around their faces. Youth A
and Youth B walked around Staff 1 and ran into the control room.
Staff 1 followed the two youths into the control room and Staff 2
radioed for assistance. There are no cameras in the control room.
Supervisor 1 and Supervisor 2 came on the pod and into the
control room. Approximately one minute later, Youth A is escorted
out of the control room by Supervisor 1 and Staff 1. Youth A
dropped to the floor and the hold is released. Youth A was holding
a pen and tried to stab Supervisor 1. Supervisor 1 and Supervisor
2 appeared to be verbally de-escalating Youth A. Youth A
eventually calmed down and sat on the floor and handed the pen
to Supervisor 1.
Documents Reviewed:
• Incident report dated 11/01/2024, written by Manager.
noted while on Pod G, Youth A and Youth B entered the
control room, Staff 1 attempted to verbally de-escalate
Youth A, but Youth A refused to exit the control room.
Supervisor 1 and Supervisor 2 arrived on the scene to
assist. Supervisor 1 and Staff 1 placed Youth A in a one
arm hold and escorted Youth A out of the control room.
Youth A took a pen out of the control room and when Staff
1 attempted to retrieve the pen Youth A stabbed Staff 1
with the pen.
Analysis The agency is found in non-compliance as per video footage
reviewed, staff and youths’ interviews, Staff 1 did not secure the
5

control room door as they are instructed to do, therefore allowing
the two youths to gain access to the control room.
Repeat Violations Established:
SIR 2023C0000484 dated 08/07/2023, CAP approved 08/29/2023
SIR 2023C0000575 dated 08/16/2023, CAP approved 10/16/2023
SIR 2023C0000774SI dated 10/31/2023, CAP approved 11/28/23
SIR 2024SIC0001352 dated 07/24/2024, CAP not yet approved
SIR 2024SIC0001559 dated 07/05/2024, CAP approved 11/25/24
Conclusion Violation Established
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 11/02/24, Youth B was evaluated by the nurse and reported
that staff beat him up. Youth B sustained scratches and bruising to
the back, wrist, stomach, and side of the forehead.
Investigation Please note, the allegations identify Youth B, but through
interviews it was determined Youth A was the youth involved in
the allegations.
Youth A reported that he blacked out during the incident in the
control room and can’t remember what happened. He does recall
pushing Staff 1 and Staff 1 grabbed his arm trying to get him out
of the control room. Youth A said he does have a scratch on his
back and wrist. He does not know how he got the injuries because
there was a lot going on and he does not remember what
happened. Youth A was observed and there were no marks or
bruises on his forehead and has one superficial scratch on his left
wrist. Youth A was observed to have acne on his face and neck.
Youth B denied witnessing Staff beat Youth A during the incident
in the control room. He said Staff 1 was talking to them to go back
6

to the pod, and Youth A was the one that was pushing, hitting, and
trying to stab staff.
Staff 1 and Supervisor 1 denied hitting or doing anything to hurt
Youth A while escorting him out of the control. Youth A was
punching and hitting things in the control room. They both denied
observing any injuries on Youth A after the incident.
Staff 2 denied Youth A was beaten or hurt while being escorted
out of the control room. Staff 2 reported Youth A was the
aggressor and was hitting and trying to stab staff with a pen.
Supervisor 2 reported Youth A was aggressive, running around
punching and hit his head against the wall on the pod. Supervisor
2 denied staff hurt Youth A.
Video Footage Reviewed:
Staff 1 and Supervisor 1 escort Youth A escort Youth A out of the
control room. Youth A drops to the floor and Staff 1 and
Supervisor release the hold. Youth A walking around the pod
swinging his arms attempting to stab Staff 1, at no point do the
staff or supervisor hit or are physical aggressive with Youth A. At
one point Youth A is seen hitting his head against the wall, and
eventually he calms down and sits on the floor.
Documents Reviewed:
• Incident report dated 11/02/2024, noted Youth A was
examined by the Doctor, Youth A had a scratch on his back
and wrist, and ankle.
• Staff 1 personnel file, there is no disciplinary records. Staff
1 completed all required training including Mandt System
verbal de-escalation and physical skills) on 08/29/24 and
08/30/2024.
• Staff 2 personnel file there is no disciplinary records. Staff 1
completed the Mandt System (verbal de-escalation and
physical skills) on 09/16/24 and 09/17/2024.
• Youth Discipline & Behavior Modification Policy states any
type of physical discipline is prohibited. The use of verbal
and non-physical crisis intervention should be utilized first
and may prevent the need for physical intervention. A youth
initiating physical contact with a staff or another person with
the intent of controlling or harming that person and/or picks
up something to use as a weapon is considered a physical
assault. The appropriate staff response is to use a safe
physical management procedure to control the youth and
7

then use the Behavior Management Procedure until the
youth is under physical and emotional control.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as per video reviewed, staff
and youths interviewed there is insufficient evidence staff beat
Youth A. Youth A was the aggressor and it could not be
determined how Youth A sustained the scratches.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
